frame.name: Co-association
frame.definition: <def-root>Two or more individuals have a relationship by virtue of belonging to the same organization or institution. They may or may not be personally acquainted, and may or may not have chosen to have the relationship.</def-root>

FE.name: Participant1
FE.definition: <def-root>The profiled member of a co-association relationship.</def-root>

FE.name: Participant2
FE.definition: <def-root>The backgrounded member(s) of a Co-association relationship.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place at which the Co-association relationship exists.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time during which the co-association relationship exists.</def-root>

FE.name: Institution
FE.definition: <def-root>The institution or organization that the <fen>Participants</fen> have in common.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: associate.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a fellow member of a firm, especially a person having high rank within a partnership or private company.

lexUnit.name: colleague.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A person working together with another in the same institution.

lexUnit.name: co-worker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: fellow worker; someone who works for the same company or institution.

lexUnit.name: countryman.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: people from the same country, or having the same citizenship.

lexUnit.name: partner.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: fellow member of the same partership. This is a business usage, as opposed to the use in the Personal_relatoinship frame.

lexUnit.name: co-religionist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a fellow member of the same religion.

lexUnit.name: fellow.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: Having the same employer, belonging to the same organization or institution, of the same nationality, etc.

lexUnit.name: comrade.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: member of the same political party or military institution, co-worker.

lexUnit.name: brother.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: member of the same fraternal organization or men's religious order. More generally, member of the same church or labor union (the latter usually plural, including the form "bretheren").

lexUnit.name: sister.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: member of the same sororal organization, especially women's religious organization or labor union.
